Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: https://github.com/blackjok3rtt/chips3/tree/verushash

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: If anyone wants to see if they can fix it.

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: ```I believe all you'd need is to replace the blockhash with the VerusHash block hash. To do that, you'd want to use haraka* and verus_hash.* from the crypto directory, and to move SerializeVerusHash and VerusHashWriter from hash.h in the src directory to your hash.h. You should also copy the hash function pointer and selection from CBlockHeader to support portability and performance and make it easier to port. Then, at runtime, just make sure to call CVerusHash::Init() and select your hash function to set the function pointer. Of course, with a height dependent change, you may want the main hash function for CBlockHeader to just select between what you use now and VerusHash. I think that would cover everything.```

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: All I left out, was the actual height activation and CVerusHash::Init()  call.

Author: blackjok3r#3181

ERROR: CScriptCheck(): 1a396d3fd35c7a78615d59bec069b53b8370e8c5fbe17022ef7293143d17587b:0 VerifySignature failed: Script evaluated without error but finished with a false/empty top stack element

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: I added a print for those errors too to see the source coin the failed TX is from, the intention was to log these and try to correlate if they were a failed notrarization on notarystats.com data. But I haven't go that far yet.

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: generally speaking it seems they are.

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: and the number of them is massive

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: Also to note, they happen on KMD->BTC, and the notarystats.com website does not report these, because they are a KMD failed TX not the actualt BTC notarization, so we have been skipping KMD->BTC notarizations aswell.
